data.title: Gunboat halts to shoot
data.body: introduced in #7067.

data.title: Fix a collection of whitespace-style issues in Mods.Common.
data.body: As reported by our Stylecop rules.

data.title: Fix worms not releasing targets when they move deep onto rock
data.body:
Meant to fix the problem described in #7125, introduced by  #6821.
Basically the worm checked if a target is valid when:
- Searching for one
- Launching an attack against the current target

This means that if a unit reached solid ground before an attack, one of 2 things would happen:
- It will be on rock, but near the edge and inside the worm's attack range. The worm will then try to launch the attack and see that the target is no longer valid and move on.
- It will move deep within the rock "island", far from the worm's attack range. The worm would then continue its AttackMoveActivity indefinitely, causing it to not move and also ignore any other possible targets.

I added a check for target validity on each tick of the Attack activity. Now once the target is out of reach the worm should just move on and forget about it.

Note: There were several approaches proposed for fixing the issue, but I feel that:
- This is the simplest one
- It is the most consistent one with what the worm logic already uses
- It is probably the safest way to go and not have a 100 cases where the other approaches might fail

data.title: Worms don't release targets once they move on to rock
data.body:
Repro case:
1. Build a vehicle and drive it near a worm.
2. Move the vehicle back onto rock.
3. Observe the worm stop moving, and completely ignore other actors.

data.title: d2k map maintenance
data.body:
- [x] the currently shipping maps need worms added to them
- [x] d2k generally needs more maps now that the most sought-after features are in. Those maps will also need worms.

Here's a list of the best-looking (judging by the thumbnail) maps I found on the resource site:
- ~~http://resource.openra.net/maps/1470~~
- ~~http://resource.openra.net/maps/990~~ (whoops, we already got those two)
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/1696
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/1661

data.title: Clean up some code style issues.
Move more files away from OpenRA.Mods.RA
data.body:
Basically what's in this PR:
- Moved several traits from Mods.RA to Mods.Common
- Moved several render traits from Mods.RA to Mods.TS
- Made TD and TS namespaces consistent with what was decided in #7036
- Moved the Drag activity from Mods.RA to Mods.Common

**Note** : It's getting harder and harder to stay away from the `Building` trait with every following migration PR. That thing is tied up to pretty much everything - PathFinding, Movement, Attacks, Weapons, Turrets, Renders...
Either someone has to deal with  #7035 soon, or I will have to make a very big bulk migration of **a lot** of files in the near future.

data.title: Add Launch.Connect command and on-connect mod switching.
data.body:
This cleans up some of the early startup code, restores support for connecting to a server from the commandline, and adds support for switching mods when connecting to a server.  Closes #4521 and implements the majority of #7058.

I have restricted this to just the back end changes: I have a second PR that makes all mod's games available in the server browser, and #4528 will add the front end for replays under Linux.

data.title: Change keyboard input to use scancodes.
data.body:
Keyboard input should now use scancodes instead of keysyms.
I also removed a lot of the Keycode enums, just because they aren't used.

I might have made a typo with the enumeration, so we should test all of the inputs. I'm not sure where all of them are used.
I tested to see if production shortcuts, deploy and changing shortcuts worked.

data.title: Fixed a Fatal Lua Error in the first Allies mission
data.body: introduced in #7081.

data.title: Allow helicopters to change stances
data.body:
As of now, it's not possible to change stance for helicopters or at least for Allied Longbow in RA. This leads to Longbow(s) chasing after Migs, resp. airplanes which is, well, something you probably don't want. Other enemy units than airplanes will be chased as well, I guess, but I haven't tested it.

Observed on SP map _Intervention!_.

data.body:
And moves them to subfolders/namespaces accordingly.

Preparation for later move to Mods.Common.

data.title: Bogus yaml checking
data.body: Allows classes that implement ITraitInfo to specify a method that is called after the Info class has been made and checks for some TraitSpecific stuff like if two arrays should be the same size.

data.title: Grant upgrade on Damage
data.body: This grants an upgrade when the actors health falls below the specified threshold.

data.title: Damaged by terrain
data.body: This is a trait that replaces the PoisonedByTiberium trait for a more general approach, this now not only works on resources but also on terrain, have a unit that cant live on anything but tiberium add Clear and Beach to the Terrain variable (you might need to add Rough too but I have no idea what terrain that is).

data.title: Cache the initial path layer for faster path search startups.
data.body:
Reinitializing the initial cell info layer for the path search took a fair bit of time. We cache this initial setup so it only has to be done each time the map size changes. A CopyValuesFrom method in CellLayer is provided which copies values between layers by just copying the internal arrays for speed.

On the RA shellmap, this reduces CPU time spent in InitCellInfo from 3.4% overall to 0.3% overall.

data.title: Made Common namespaces more consistent
data.body:
This is a follow-up on the decision we've come to in #7036.

A lot of the traits in Common still used old RA-style namespaces. This moves them to Common.Traits.

Additionally, this moves a couple more traits from RA to Common.

data.title: Move Upgrades and Prerequisites from Mods.RA to Mods.Common
data.body:
Moved two interfaces from `Mods.RA.TraitInterfaces.cs` to `Mods.RA.CommonTraitInterfaces.cs`:
- ITechTreePrerequisite
- ITechTreeElement

Moved six classes from Mods.RA to Mods.Common:
- Buildable
- ProvidesTechPrerequisite
- ProvidesCustomPrerequisite
- GlobalUpgradable
- GlobalUpgradeManager
- TechTree

Note: I noticed a folder called "Upgrades" in Mods.Common, containing an `UpgradeManager`. Should I be using that folder for the upgrades, or move them to locations corresponding to their current ones (as I did)?

data.title: "base under attack" not played when distant building is under attack
data.body:
I believe player should be notified when any of his buildings are being attacked, not just those which are in the vicinity of Construction Yard.

For example, on RA SP map _Intervention!_. You start on a small island, move to the mainland and leave some buildings behind. AI does para-drop on the islad a bit later and attacks buildings you've left behind, yet no sound is played nor notification on radar is shown about this.

data.title: Older building overlapped by a newer one
data.body:
I sent a guy to scout the blue base from the north, and he saw an advanced power plant.
Later I sent another guy to the back (south) of the blue base and he saw a refinery in place of the advanced power plant.
Despite the fact I have only seen the beginning of its lower left cell, the whole refinery has been updated under the fog of war.
![newer on older](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/5356868/b9f582c6-7fa1-11e4-92b1-b0d1ba82722b.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Ability to airdrop vehicles?
data.body:
Is is possible to implement vehicle airdrops? I tried to add it as a feature for NOD in my mod, but the game crashes right before the plane can drop it's cargo.

I get this crashlog:

Tiberian Origins Mod at Version Beta 0.25a
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.17929
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Effects.Parachute.<Render>c__Iterator0.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<SelectManyIterator>d__14`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__71`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__71`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.GenerateRenderables()
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw()
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

Here is the code for the paradrop:

```
ParatroopersPower:
    Icon: paratroopers
    ChargeTime: 360
    Description: Reinforcements
    LongDesc: A C17 cargo plane drops reinforcements\nanywhere on the map.
    DropItems: BGGY,LTNK,BIKE
    UnitType: c17supply #->this works, I use the same unit to paradrop infantry for GDI
    SelectTargetSound: slcttgt1.aud
    AllowImpassableCells: false
    QuantizedFacings: 8
    CameraActor: camera.paradrop
    DisplayBeacon: true
    BeaconPoster: pinficon
```

data.title: Cleaned up Server class
data.body:
In a step towards network data compression, server class needed some cleaning since it hasn't been touched since forever.

Now organized with regions. All those many vague DispatchOrders have been reduced to one method so it's a lot clearer. Added readonly to appropriate fields, removed public access to others, fixed some style issues. Removed the "volatile" field that isn't necessary for an enum (which is an atomic type...and said field is not even set from the server thread)
